metadata.title: Landing Page Benchmark Research and Structural Audit (SaaS References + Chrome DevTools MCP)
metadata.prd_reference: 5 Frontend Design Guidelines + user Healio UI pillars (trust, frictionless workflows, bento clarity)

context.background: This task creates a research-backed foundation for redesigning the Healio marketing landing page. It must benchmark high-quality SaaS/homepage patterns (especially trustworthy B2B/product-led experiences), inspect their structure using Chrome DevTools MCP, and translate findings into a Healio-specific structural audit for a multi-tenant clinic operations product.

design_constraints.constraint: Benchmark pages should prioritize trust, clarity, strong information hierarchy, and conversion-focused structure suitable for healthcare operations software.
Explicitly evaluate patterns relevant to Healio: Stripe-like frictionless UX framing, Viedoc-like soft/bento data storytelling, and high-legibility design for stressed clinic staff.
Tailor findings to a multi-tenant SaaS narrative (clinic owner/admin/doctor/receptionist role support, tenant isolation, centralized operations, and scale from solo clinic to growing practice).
Do not copy visual language directly; extract reusable structural patterns (hero composition, proof blocks, feature sections, CTA sequencing, navigation density, footer structure, trust signals).

instruction.step: Search the web for high-quality SaaS/product landing pages relevant to Healioâ€™s target positioning (B2B operations tools, fintech-quality trust UX, healthcare/clinical software, modern productivity SaaS).

Use Chrome DevTools MCP to inspect the DOM/content structure of selected reference sites (hero, section order, CTA placement, social proof, feature cards, navigation/footer), and record structural notes rather than copying branded styling.
Create `healio/docs/marketing/landing-page-benchmark.md` summarizing 3-5 references with: why chosen, structural breakdown, reusable patterns, anti-patterns to avoid, and Healio-specific adaptations.

Audit the current `healio/app/page.tsx` and document what should change (showcase/dev-demo content to remove, missing SaaS messaging, missing multi-tenant value proposition, missing trust/conversion sections).
Produce a recommended Healio landing page section sequence that will be implemented by follow-on tasks.

validation_checklist.check: Record at least 3 external references with links and structural notes, not just visual adjectives.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP for structure inspection and record evidence (snapshots/notes) for each inspected reference.
Include a Healio-specific section order recommendation tied to multi-tenant clinic SaaS positioning.
Document at least one anti-pattern to avoid (for example, generic hero copy, overly dense tables, weak CTA hierarchy, or confusing navigation).

artifacts.artifact: Research/benchmark document with source links and structural audit
Landing page implementation plan inputs for follow-on tasks

acceptance_criteria.criterion: `healio/docs/marketing/landing-page-benchmark.md` exists and contains benchmark references, structural analysis, and Healio-specific adaptations.
The document clearly distinguishes reusable structure patterns from brand-specific styling to avoid direct imitation.
The recommended section sequence supports a multi-tenant, multi-role clinic SaaS positioning and aligns with the PRD/user design direction.
Chrome DevTools MCP was used to inspect reference structures and evidence is recorded before marking the task complete.
